intro: Elisanthe olgae, commonly known as the coastal sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Elisanthe olgae is often found in maritime climates and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
